slides.title: Online Booking
slides.narration: What if customers could book appointments anytime—while you're with other clients, after hours, on weekends? Online booking makes that possible. Let's set it up.

slides.title: What You'll Set Up
slides.narration: We'll configure your availability calendar, define your service types and how long each takes, set booking rules like buffer time and advance notice, and set up automatic confirmations and reminders.

slides.title: Step 1: Set Availability
slides.narration: First, set your availability. Define working hours for each day—they don't have to be the same. Mark days you're available. Block out lunch and break times. Add vacation or blackout dates. The system only shows times you're actually free.

slides.title: Step 2: Define Services

for_each_service: Who can perform it (if multiple staff)

slides.narration: Add your services. For each one: the service name, how long it takes, price if you want to show it, a brief description, and who can perform it if you have multiple staff. Customers will select from this menu when booking.

slides.title: Step 3: Booking Rules
slides.narration: Set booking rules. Minimum advance notice—how much warning you need. Maximum advance booking—how far ahead people can book. Buffer time between appointments for prep or travel. Your cancellation policy. And whether to require payment or deposit upfront.

slides.title: Step 4: Notifications
slides.narration: Configure notifications. Booking confirmation goes out immediately. Reminder twenty-four hours before reduces no-shows significantly. Optional one-hour reminder for forgetful clients. Follow-up after the appointment for feedback or rebooking. All automatic.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Add booking link to email signature

slides.narration: Booking pro tips. Add your booking link to your email signature—every email becomes a booking opportunity. Share on social media profiles. That twenty-four hour reminder reduces no-shows by about forty percent. And sync with your Google or Outlook calendar so everything stays in one place.

slides.title: Start Taking Bookings
slides.narration: Ready to take bookings twenty-four seven? Set up your booking system now. Or preview how it looks to customers first. Stop playing phone tag—let customers book when it's convenient for them.
